availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Urban Ewing Kennedy (Todd County, KY, farmer and postmaster)

body.p: Todd County, Kentucky, farmer and postmaster. Kentucky native. Married to Levina Bryan Kennedy in Todd County on March 17, 1823. Father of Urban Kennedy, David Kennedy, Henry Kennedy, Mary Kennedy, and Michael R. Kennedy. Married to Achsah H. Knight Kennedy in Todd County on May 3, 1845. Father of Theodore C. Kennedy, William A. Kennedy, Lavinia C. Kennedy, J.D. Kennedy, and Ben B. Kennedy. Resident in Todd County in 1830. Owned two enslaved persons in Todd County in 1830. Farmer in Todd County in 1850. Owned 14 enslaved persons in 1850. Postmaster of Fairview from January 15, 1853, to June 27,1854. Farmer in Todd County in 1860. Owned 16 enslaved persons in 1860. Grand jury foreman in 1861.
